pull.title: refactor: enable `move-const-arg` for trivially-copyable types

verification.payload:
tree fc4e6d0dd2b53b1a5360fa5daa8fd2e7f410bfda
parent eb97250421d35f8c172d43b69965af6273025702
author Lőrinc <pap.lorinc@gmail.com> 1770289731 +0100
committer Lőrinc <pap.lorinc@gmail.com> 1770296720 +0100

coins: avoid moving `COutPoint` in snapshot load

`EmplaceCoinInternalDANGER` took `COutPoint&&`, forcing callers to `std::move()` a trivially-copyable value.

Take the `outpoint` by const reference instead.

Co-authored-by: Andrew Toth <andrewstoth@gmail.com>

events.message:

verification.payload:
tree 29d9cbc6da2fef790e42b9d1c3bbd0ee78193aed
parent c466621d5a8001f8d51c817ae1372260fad5d573
author Lőrinc <pap.lorinc@gmail.com> 1770289938 +0100
committer Lőrinc <pap.lorinc@gmail.com> 1770296820 +0100

logging: pass `SourceLocation` by const reference

Logging helpers took `SourceLocation&&`, forcing pointless `std::move()` at call sites even though `SourceLocation` is trivially copyable.

Accept `const SourceLocation&` in `LogPrintFormatInternal`, `LogPrintStr`, and `LogPrintStr_`.

events.message:
logging: pass `SourceLocation` by const reference

Logging helpers took `SourceLocation&&`, forcing pointless `std::move()` at call sites even though `SourceLocation` is trivially copyable.

Accept `const SourceLocation&` in `LogPrintFormatInternal`, `LogPrintStr`, and `LogPrintStr_`.

verification.payload:
tree 0b23d51b5d2e69fa85d09c5c94d0739e0309f74f
parent a6f725e9045e45fe98acef770888702dd8052ee2
author Lőrinc <pap.lorinc@gmail.com> 1770290327 +0100
committer Lőrinc <pap.lorinc@gmail.com> 1770296821 +0100

random: do not move `CSHA512` into `MixExtract`

`RNGState::MixExtract` took `CSHA512&&`, forcing `std::move()` at call sites even though `CSHA512` is trivially copyable.

Accept `CSHA512&` and keep `SeedStrengthen()` mixing in a copy of the current hasher state.

events.message:
random: do not move `CSHA512` into `MixExtract`

`RNGState::MixExtract` took `CSHA512&&`, forcing `std::move()` at call sites even though `CSHA512` is trivially copyable.

Accept `CSHA512&` and keep `SeedStrengthen()` mixing in a copy of the current hasher state.

verification.payload:
tree 1ad065e46e86ce8cea5d946fa81f32ee728a0472
parent cc7b77fc7865d57d7616f028b5cfbb9d8abe7353
author Lőrinc <pap.lorinc@gmail.com> 1770290429 +0100
committer Lőrinc <pap.lorinc@gmail.com> 1770297061 +0100

txmempool: stop forcing `std::move` on `Options`

`CTxMemPool::Options` is trivially copyable, but the `Flatten()`/`CTxMemPool()` signatures forced `std::move()` at call sites.

Take options by value in `Flatten()` and by const reference in `CTxMemPool()`.

events.message:
txmempool: stop forcing `std::move` on `Options`

`CTxMemPool::Options` is trivially copyable, but the `Flatten()`/`CTxMemPool()` signatures forced `std::move()` at call sites.

Take options by value in `Flatten()` and by const reference in `CTxMemPool()`.

clang-tidy: apply move-const-arg fix-its

Stop overriding `performance-move-const-arg.CheckTriviallyCopyableMove` which defaults to `true` this way.

Apply `clang-tid`y fix-its for `performance-move-const-arg` for the remaining trivial cases.

<!--5faf32d7da4f0f540f40219e4f7537a3-->
### LLM Linter (✨ experimental)



Possible places where named args for integral literals may be used (e.g. `func(x, /*named_arg=*/0)` in C++, and `func(x, named_arg=0)` in Python):

- rng.MixExtract(strengthen_seed, sizeof(strengthen_seed), strengthen_hasher, false, /*always_use_real_rng=*/true) in src/random.cpp
- rng.MixExtract(out, num, hasher, false, always_use_real_rng) in src/random.cpp
- rng.MixExtract(out, num, startup_hasher, true, always_use_real_rng) in src/random.cpp
- GetRNGState().MixExtract(nullptr, 0, to_add, false, /*always_use_real_rng=*/true) in src/random.cpp
- std::clamp<int>(opts.check_ratio, 0, 1'000'000) in src/txmempool.cpp
- LogInstance().LogPrintStr(msg, loc, category, level, /*should_ratelimit=*/false) in src/test/logging_tests.cpp



<sup>2026-02-05 13:28:39</sup>

Not sure, but I don't mind the change.

Just to clarify, this was done intentionally, see the reasons inline. Maybe docs or a comment could be added to clarify this?

Using `std::move` on a const-qualified object has no observable effect in code generation, and it **harms readability**.  The reader may assume that it causes a movable type to move, when it is actually copied.

Using `std::move` on trivially copyable types also has no observable effect in code generation, but it may **improve readability** to use it, because it signals intent, as @maflcko wrote above ("mark a symbol used").

I would consider setting `CheckTriviallyCopyableMove` to false in [move-const-arg](https://clang.llvm.org/extra/clang-tidy/checks/performance/move-const-arg.html). Also, make sure not to introduce regressions for [pass-by-value](https://clang.llvm.org/extra/clang-tidy/checks/modernize/pass-by-value.html).

> Using `std::move` on a const-qualified object has no observable effect in code generation, and it **harms readability**. The reader may assume that it causes a movable type to move, when it is actually copied.
> 
> Using `std::move` on trivially copyable types also has no observable effect in code generation, but it may **improve readability** to use it, because it signals intent, as @maflcko wrote above ("mark a symbol used").
> 
> I would consider setting `CheckTriviallyCopyableMove` to false in [move-const-arg](https://clang.llvm.org/extra/clang-tidy/checks/performance/move-const-arg.html). Also, make sure not to introduce regressions for [pass-by-value](https://clang.llvm.org/extra/clang-tidy/checks/modernize/pass-by-value.html).

I think all of your points are already implemented since faad673716c (zirka 2022)

I'm ~0 on this:
* It's nice to clear away what can be seen as noise.
* It's nice to document intent ("mark a symbol used") as 2 prior commenters have pointed out.

comments.body:
This was written intentionally, because:

* If the options layout changes in the future, it will optimize "for free"
* There is no harm in having the move, other than it being a bit confusing
* Using `std::move` also has the benefit to mark a symbol used, regardless of its memory layout (ref use-after-move clang-tidy check)
nit: It is unspecified whether `std::source_location` is trivial or not: https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/utility/source_location/source_location.html

I'm not sure about the third point.

> the benefit to mark a symbol as used

Why is it a benefit in this case? Wouldn't this be better leaving the constructor parameter alone and passing a non-const ref to `Flatten`?

nit: Might as well dodge one copy, even though the type is barely bigger than a pointer:
```suggestion
CoinsViews::CoinsViews(DBParams db_params, const CoinsViewOptions& options)
```

In constructors, the pass-by-value-and-move-into-place is the right approach. This only applies to constructors, not setter functions. See https://stackoverflow.com/questions/26261007/why-is-value-taking-setter-member-functions-not-recommended-in-herb-sutters-cpp for details.
right. Maybe here, but not in `src/random.cpp`. Re-using a cleared vanilla hasher after move for randomness seems slightly non-ideal.

That makes sense for types like `std::string` which likely contain pointers to memory in other locations (also true for `DBParams` in this example). It's not as clear-cut for simpler types like `CoinsViewOptions`:
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/32f00a544d3c0adb066c6ffb375787be9bb8c6cb/src/txdb.h#L26-L31

Taking by const-ref should be slightly more optimal, but it's not important to me. Maybe the 2 fields of the struct can be passed in 2 registers, I'm not too familiar with calling conventions.
